DOC.brief_summary: We hypothesize that premature infants who receive their mothers' expressed breast milk supplemented with liquid protein early in their hospitalization will have a growth velocity in the first 28 days of life that is 20% greater than the growth velocity of premature infants that do not receive protein fortification.
DOC.brief_title: Early Protein Supplementation of Human Milk in Extremely Low Birth Weight Infants
DOC.criteria: inborn at Mount Sinai Medical Center gestational age between 26 0/7 weeks and 32 6/7 weeks gestation plan by family for their infant to receive human milk feeds outborn infants gestational age < 26 0/7 weeks or > 33 0/7 weeks major congenital anomalies including cardiac disease, inborn errors of metabolism etc. sepsis and/or other serious clinical complication precluding initiation of enteral feeds plan by family for their infant to receive primarily preterm infant formula.
